transcript.title: Sydney Olympic Bid Presentation, Monte Carlo, Monaco
transcript.content:
23 September 1993

Journalist; Â Mr Keating, your impressions of the presentation?

PM: Well, I thought the presentation went exceptionally well. I felt the actualÂ format of the presentation was very impressive and its the first time I'd actuallyÂ seen it from front to back. And, one gets a good guide to how one's emotionsÂ are responding to these things and I thought, after a couple of film clips, oneÂ should break out and cheer. But we resisted doing that and I think theÂ presentation went very nicely and we got the key messages we wanted over,Â Â for Sydney Â - all of us

Journalist;Â Mrs Keating how did you feel about it?

Annita Keating Â I thought it was great, fantastic.

Journalist;Â :Â Mr Keating there is a suggestion doing the rounds this morning that we'veÂ slipped into third behind Manchester. Would you give that any credence?

PM: Â  I think, at this stage of the game, its like trying to pick a Surry HillsÂ selectionÂ ballot at five to six on a Saturday night Â - forget about it.

Journalist;Mr Keating, what's the task for the bid in the next few hours before the actualÂ ballot. What remains to be done?

John Fahey; Stay sober. Stay sober, there's nothing more we can do except wait now forÂ the results.

PM: Yes, I think it's in the box, as they say.

Ends.
